creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: small pottery flatish jar with unglazed dark grey clay; impressed with inscribed seal; side seams visible
text: Japanese monks traveling to China found the naturalism of leaf-decorated teabowls especially to their liking and brought back a number of them when they returned home. The effect was produced by affixing a leaf with high silica content to the interior of the bowl before immersing it in iron-rich slurry used to create the dark brown glaze. In the heat of the kiln, the silica remains after the organic material of the leaf burns away, creating the ghost-like image of the leaf.
title: Jar
